banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Weaving a strong smart grid

nodes.whoTheyAre: Lorie Wigle is on a mission to remove the vulnerabilities of the electricity grid. As the general manager of Intel’s eco-technology office, Wigle focuses on the positive environmental impact of Intel’s products. Her work on new business opportunities from use of Intel technologies to address environmental challenges led to the effort on smart grid. She works with policymakers while also playing leadership roles in the Climate Savers Computing Initiative and The Green Grid.

videoData.description: Integrating disparate national electricity systems into a smart grid allows us to integrate renewable energy, be more efficient and empower consumers to use power wisely. But as we add intelligence to these systems, we introduce a vulnerability into it as well. Lorie Wigle outlines a new project to protect these complex and vital grids from attack.
videoData.socialDescription: Integrating disparate national electricity systems into a smart grid allows us to integrate renewable energy, be more efficient and empower consumers to use power wisely. But as we add intelligence to these systems, we introduce a vulnerability into it as well. Lorie Wigle outlines a new project to protect these complex and vital grids from attack.
